definition: to seize control of (an enemy position)/(fig.) to take by storm/to gain (awards, control of a market etc)
to take possession of/to occupy/to take up

sentences.english: They conquered the southern part of the country in a few months.
sentences.chinese: 他们在几个月的时间里攻占了该国的南部。

sentences.english: It took them a whole day to take the enemy fortress.
sentences.chinese: 他们花了一整天才攻占了敌堡。

sentences.english: On May 7-8, Tunis and Bizerte are captured.
sentences.chinese: 五月7至8日，突尼斯和比塞大被盟军攻占。

sentences.english: Let's anticipate the enemy's move and occupy that city.
sentences.chinese: 我们要制敌先机抢先攻占那个城市。

sentences.english: The soldiers recaptured the city lost to the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 士兵们收复被敌人攻占的城市。

sentences.english: Well, eventually the ottoman Turks attacked Constantinople, it eventually fell.
sentences.chinese: 最后，君士坦丁堡被土耳其攻占最终沦陷了。

sentences.english: In the late eighth century, the Vikings attacked England.
sentences.chinese: 在8世纪末，斯堪的那维亚人攻占英国。

sentences.english: Qiu Changheng discloses, this is to pay treasure to razzia another hilltop is in prepare.
sentences.chinese: 邱昌恒透露，这是为支付宝攻占另一个山头在做准备。

sentences.english: He formed a part of the eighth corps of the grand army which Mortier commanded, and which captured Hamburg.
sentences.chinese: 他也参加了在莫蒂埃指挥下攻占汉堡的大军第八兵团。

sentences.english: The leaders of the insurrectionary army beat up the newly captured town for recruits.
sentences.chinese: 起义军的首领们在新攻占的城里四出奔走，招募新兵。

sentences.english: He fought many battles, and took the strong holds of all, and slew the kings of the earth.
sentences.chinese: 他身经百战，攻占了许多要塞，斩杀了各地的君王。

sentences.english: Not the least which it is dependency on Monty taking Cannes by D-day.
sentences.chinese: 你至少不要指靠蒙蒂在D日攻占戛纳。

sentences.english: Targeted is an expression from mental, you should find ways to take up the mental.
sentences.chinese: 定位是一种发自心智的表达，你要想办法攻占心智。

sentences.english: They too killed, or enslaved, the people of captured towns.
sentences.chinese: 他们也杀戮，或奴役被攻占城市的人民。

definition: to overcome/to take (a fortress)/to fall (to an attack)/to surrender
to annihilate/to wipe out completely/to exterminate
stronghold/defended military base/base for operations/strategic point/foothold/(market) presence
to guard/to hold a fortified position/entrenched
to retreat and defend/to withdraw and maintain one's guard
